page.title: 19VIRGINIA WATER LAKE
page.content: {VIRGINIA WATER LAKE: Virginia Water Lake is owned by the Queen. Ducks and fish live there. Anyone is allowed to walk round the lake. We go there to walk the dog and for picnics. There is a waterfall at one end and a bridge at the other. A huge totem pole given to the{Queen by Canadian Indians stands on the northern bank. Lots of azaleas and specimen trees grow round the lake. In winter the long grass slopes make good sledging runs. There are car parks at each entrance. It is 4 miles round. There are 65 gardeners in the{Great {Park.}The park pale is an old ditch which formed the boundary of Windsor Great Park. They plant pine trees and when they reach a good size they are cut down and sold.
